items.title: The start
items.description: Demeter: the goddess of Agriculture, Grain, and Fertility. Persephone: Demeter's daugther

items.title: The day of Persephone's kidnap
items.description: Persephone is kidnapped while Demeter, her mother, is away.

items.title: Persephone's kidnap
items.description: Persephone ends up in the Underworld; The Underworld is where dead souls end up at

items.title: Demeter's search
items.description: Demeter realizes that Zeus, her father, allowed Hades to take away Persephone to marry her without either Demter or her consent.

items.title: Demeter and the affects of her neglect
items.description: With the relization of Persephone being taken away, Demeter searchers for Persephone on her own, meaning that she didn't focus on her tasks, leading to crops drying and famine plagueing the earth. Although Zeus ordered Demeter to stop, as it is affect the mortals and in turn the gods as no one would be worshipping them, she refuses.

items.title: Persephone's current life in the Underworld
items.description: Stuck in the Underworld, Persephone refuses to be Hades' wife. Missing life and her mother above, and wadering around the Underworld, helpless and hungry.

items.title: Demeter's continued Search
items.description: Demeter doesn't give up, asks the sun-god Helios for help and he let her know about the demands of Hades, the betryal of Zeus and Persephone being abducted by Hades. Demeter confronted Zeus and when he refused to give back Demeter, she vowed for the fields to never be fertile until she reunites with Persephone.

items.title: Persephone's fate
items.description: Persephone eats the seeds of a promogrante, which fixes her fate in the underworld, but Demeter refused this and vowed to not make the fields fertile until she was reunited with Persephone.

items.title: The pact
items.description: A pact was made, where Persephone would be on land for 2/3 of the year, with the rest being spent in the Underworld. The mother and daughter and nurutred the fields together. The mortals saw Persephone's arrival as the start of the spring, with her exit as the start of winter that would be difficult

items.title: End
items.description: Knowing that Demeter cannot be taken away from the grief of Persephone leaving for the last 1/3, the mortals would survive and wait for the arrival of Persephone. The transition of Persephone from land to Underworld and vice versa marked the changing of the seasons for mortals.
